name: lithologic modeling
desc: Estimate material data to generate a lithologic model.

properties.name: New Variables
properties.desc: The New Variables toggle resets all expert system calculated variables to zero before each run. This allows multiple calculations to be performed without tedious manual resetting of these variables. To change an expert system calculated variable, the toggle must be off.

properties.name: Only Create Grid
properties.desc: The Only Create Grid toggle forces the module to exit after the gridding is complete with no interpolation done.

properties.name: Grid Coordinates
properties.desc: Allows the user to define the coordinate domain within the data set in which kriging will be completed. Please read the help for more information on these parameters.

properties.name: X Resolution
properties.desc: The X Resolution specifies the number of grid nodes that will be included within the model horizontal domain.

properties.name: Y Resolution
properties.desc: The Y Resolution specifies the number of grid nodes that will be included within the model vertical domain.

properties.name: Z Resolution
properties.desc: The Z Resolution specifies the number of grid nodes that will be included within the model elevation domain when creating a single layer.

properties.name: Cell Set Subdivision
properties.desc: The Generate Sets option allows the user to select whether the output is grouped into materials, grouped into layers or not grouped and thus containing individual materials per layer.

properties.name: Layers From Geology
properties.desc: The Layers from Geology control is used with input geology port. It can be used to create a single layer or a layer for each horizon

properties.name: Proportional Gridding
properties.desc: When multiple geologic layers exist, cells are apportioned to layers in Z, based on each layer’s average thickness over the total model domain, but further subject to the “Min Cells Per Layer” parameter.  Actual Z Resolution may be higher than specified.

properties.name: Min Cells Per Layer
properties.desc: The minimum number of cells (in the Z direction) per layer. This option is used when proportionally gridding an input geologic grid.

properties.name: Cells Per Layer
properties.desc: The Cells (in the Z direction) per layer when using the selected Proportional Gridding option. This option is used when proportioning an input geologic grid.

properties.name: Min Layer Thickness
properties.desc: The Minimum Layer Thickness is the smallest vertical height of each cell.

properties.name: Reverse Surface Hierarchy
properties.desc: Reversing Surface Hierarchy will define layers starting from the bottom to the top.

properties.name: Rectilinear Offset
properties.desc: Rectilinear Offset is used to create a domain that is larger than the input data along all three axes.

properties.name: Estimation Type
properties.desc: The Estimation Type will allow the user to select from between the Nearest Neighbor and Kriging algorithms.

properties.name: Lithology Method
properties.desc: The Lithology Method allows the user to select the unrefined (Block) or the refinement (Smooth) algorithm. The refined algorithm has a profound affect on the model creation time and memory requirements, but the Smooth method requires much lower grid resolutions to achieve great results.  It can actually provide superior results in less time with proper selection of resolutions.

properties.name: Reach
properties.desc: The Reach input field defines the radial distance (in user units) from any given model node that the kriging module will look for data points to be included in the estimation of the model parameter at that node. Setting the reach to 0 will result in the module calculating a reach value which is approximately two-thirds of the longest distance between any two data points in the data set.

properties.name: Points In Reach
properties.desc: The Points In Reach value defines the maximum number of data points (within the specified reach) that will be considered for the parameter estimation at a model node. This value is not used for Nearest Neighbor interpolation or when the number of samples falls below the Use All Data threshold.

properties.name: Octant Search
properties.desc: When the Octant Search toggle is selected searching is performed for each of the eight Octants surrounding the point to be kriged. Within each octant a maximum number of points (up to one-fourth of the total points) are selected. Then, points are taken sequentially from each octant up to the maximum number of total points or until all octant's points have been used.

properties.name: Use All Points
properties.desc: The Use All Points toggle causes the module to include samples up to the All Points Limit value.  If the number of samples exceeds the limit value the Reach and Points In Reach settings are used.

properties.name: All Points Limit
properties.desc: The All Points Limit is the maximum number of points to use when interpolating.  If there are more samples in the file than this value the Reach and Points In Reach settings will be used.

properties.name: PGF Refine Distance
properties.desc: Understanding the PGF Refine Distance parameter requires an understanding of the basics of indicator kriging with a .PGF file as input.  Please reference the module help for more details.

properties.name: Max Points Per Interval
properties.desc: The Max Points Per Interval is used to cap the number of points created between samples in pgf data.

properties.name: Maximum Refined Points
properties.desc: The Maximum Refined Points sets a limit on the total number of points created when refining a *.pgf file.  If the number of points generated, along with the original number of file samples, are greater than this value an error will be reported.

properties.name: Variography Z Scale
properties.desc: The Variography Z Scale value sets the vertical scaling of the variography ellipsoid and lines.

properties.name: Display Variogram Ellipsoid
properties.desc: The Display Variogram Ellipsoid control allows the user to display the variography ellipsoid.

properties.name: Ellipsoid Opacity
properties.desc: The Ellipsoid Opacity control allows the user to set the opacity of the ellipsoid directly

properties.name: Resolution
properties.desc: The resolution to use for the ellipsoid. Larger numbers create more detailed representations.

properties.name: Ellipsoid Scale
properties.desc: The Ellipsoid Scale will scale the ellipsoid equally along each axis.

properties.name: X Offset
properties.desc: The X Offset slider will allow the user to translate the ellipsoid along the x axis

properties.name: Y Offset
properties.desc: The Y Offset slider will allow the user to translate the ellipsoid along the y axis

properties.name: Z Offset
properties.desc: The Z Offset slider will allow the user to translate the ellipsoid along the z axis

properties.name: Ellipsoid Color
properties.desc: The ellipsoid is a solid color which can be selected using this control.

properties.name: Display Variogram Lines
properties.desc: The Display Variogram Lines allow the user to display lines aligned with the variography ellipsoid.

properties.name: Line Scale
properties.desc: The Line Scale is a scalar that sets the lenght of the variogram lines relative the scale of the ellipsoid

properties.name: Primary Ratio Color
properties.desc: The primary ratio axis is a solid color which can be selected using this control.

properties.name: Secondary Ratio Color
properties.desc: The secondary ratio axis is a solid color which can be selected using this control.

properties.name: Tertiary Axis Color
properties.desc: The tertiary axis is a solid color which can be selected using this control.

properties.name: Geologic Nodal Data
properties.desc: The Geologic Nodal Data options let the user decide which data components to generate for the output field on a node by node basis.

properties.name: Geologic Cell Data
properties.desc: The Geologic Cell Data options let the user decide which data components to generate for the output field on a cell by cell basis.

properties.name: Probability
properties.desc: The Probability toggle exports a data value that describes the probability of that cell or node being the chosen material.

properties.name: Probabilities By Material
properties.desc: The Probability By Material exports a data value that describes the probability of that cell or node being each of the different materials.
